TopicTitle: ASET Props Pack. v1.5 (for the modders who create IVA)

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 2/10/2017 at 9:00 AM, xv323 said:
> 
> 
> [@MOARdV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/60950-moardv/)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Here's the log file as you requested.
> 

It looks like the crash is happening during RPM prop configuration.  I will need to take a look here to see if I can figure out what is going on - there are a couple of unknowns that I can't get to without making source code changes.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, MOARdV said:
> 
> 
> It looks like the crash is happening during RPM prop configuration.  I will need to take a look here to see if I can figure out what is going on - there are a couple of unknowns that I can't get to without making source code changes.
> 

Thanks. If you need anything further from me at any point as you look into this, ping me a message and I'll do my best.

So I'm not entirely sure if this is the right place to ask this. If not, just let me know and I can delete it and take my stuff to the right place. When JIT debugging is enabled, any unhandled exception will be sent to the JIT debugger registered on the computer rather than be handled by this dialog box. I'm a little too dumb to know what any of this means. Only seems to be hitting this mod.

Hello Alex. Thank you for your great work. The new props are looking great and i am really looking forward to using them.  

I am having the same problem that [@xv323](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/151705-xv323/) and [@MOARdV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/60950-moardv/) were discussing above. I use your props on my mods and the problem appeared when i tried to update the props on my Gemini Mod.  

Tried to narrow it down but the game crashes even with only RPM/ModuleManager/Aset Props and Mk1\_Lander\_Can\_IVA\_Replacement installed.

I go to the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, select the Mk1 Lander Can, add no further parts and click launch. The game starts loading and crashes before getting to the launchpad.

[@MOARdV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/60950-moardv/) i uploaded my log file too in case it helps [https://we.tl/nppuC4iK0L](https://we.tl/nppuC4iK0L)  

Let me know if you need anything else.  

I'm on KSP version 1.2.2, and Mac OSX 10.10.5.  

Hope this helps in narrowing down the issue. And again thank you both for your work.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-14T11:41:48Z" title="02/14/2017 11:41  AM" data-short="7 yr">February 14, 2017</time> by silentvelcro**

[@alexustas](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/78632-alexustas/) [@MOARdV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/60950-moardv/) any news on a fix for this issue?

> 
> 
> 18 hours ago, xv323 said:
> 
> 
> [@alexustas](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/78632-alexustas/) [@MOARdV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/60950-moardv/) any news on a fix for this issue?
> 

Sorry.  I've been thoroughly busy on other projects, so I have not had the chance to investigate.  It appears to be limited to some Mac / Linux configurations (unless I missed a report on a Windows installation seeing it), but I don't know what aspect of that is relevant, if anything.  It may be smaller vidmem on those particular machines, plus a less-than-graceful handling of out-of-memory; it may be bad handling of some of the textures that are reporting errors at load time; it may be something else.

[@alexustas](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/78632-alexustas/) [@MOARdV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/60950-moardv/) Sorry if this is duplicated in anyone else's KSP.log that may have been linked earlier... I'm getting loading errs for some of the MFD screens... Most of them are from odd-sized .dds textures, which also seem to have duplicate .pngs packaged with them... ?? Am I correct in assuming when a texture is duplicated, but as different file types, KSP will load the FIRST file type it comes across, based on alphabetical order? Because when I delete the offending .dds's, the .png's seem to then load error-free... Here's the relevant log snippet I'm getting: Spoiler ASET Props [WARNING] [DatabaseLoaderTexture_DDS+c__Iterator57.MoveNext] Texture load error in [DatabaseLoaderTexture_DDS+c__Iterator57.MoveNext] Texture load error in '\GameData\ASET\ASET_Props\MFDs\kOSTerminal\bg03.dds' [WARNING] [DatabaseLoaderTexture_DDS+c__Iterator57.MoveNext] Texture load error in '\GameData\ASET\ASET_Props\MFDs\kOSTerminal\screen-emissive.dds' [WARNING] [DatabaseLoaderTexture_DDS+c__Iterator57.MoveNext] Texture load error in '\GameData\ASET\ASET_Props\MFDs\kOSTerminal\screen.dds' [WARNING] [DatabaseLoaderTexture_DDS+c__Iterator57.MoveNext] Texture load error in '\GameData\ASET\ASET_Props\MFDs\ScreenPlates\scalebar.dds' [WARNING] [DatabaseLoaderTexture_DDS+c__Iterator57.MoveNext] Texture load error in '\GameData\ASET\ASET_Props\Misc\PSU\screen-emissive.dds' Almost all .dds have dupe .pngs... Changed extension for .dds to load .pngs...??? Worked for all except 1st err, which seems to have a different issue? I also seem to be getting a couple errors for a missing texture, as well: [INFO] [GameDatabase+c__Iterator4A.MoveNext] Load(Model): ASET/ASET_Props/Misc/Primitives/Primitive_TRIANGLE_90
[ERROR] [PartReader.ReadTextures] Texture 'ASET/ASET_Props/Misc/Primitives/PrimitiveDiffuse' not found! [INFO] [GameDatabase+c__Iterator4A.MoveNext] Load(Model): ASET/ASET_Props/Misc/Primitives/Primitive_TRIANGLE_90_Beveled
[ERROR] [PartReader.ReadTextures] Texture 'ASET/ASET_Props/Misc/Primitives/PrimitiveDiffuse' not found! **Edited February 20, 2017 by Stone Blue**

Hello. This might be in the wrong thread (maybe it should be ASET Avionics?) but can anyone here figure out why the [BDMk22](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/126333-11-bdynamics-mk22-cockpits-v11/) cockpits are not working? They seem to display a default RPM cockpit instead of the custom HUD, etc.

> 
> 
> On 2/20/2017 at 3:52 PM, Stone Blue said:
> 
> 
> [@alexustas](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/78632-alexustas/) [@MOARdV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/60950-moardv/) Sorry if this is duplicated in anyone else's KSP.log that may have been linked earlier...  
>   
> 
> I'm getting loading errs for some of the MFD screens...  
> 
> Most of them are from odd-sized .dds textures, which also seem to have duplicate .pngs packaged with them... ??  
>   
> 
> Am I correct in assuming when a texture is duplicated, but as different file types, KSP will load the FIRST file type it comes across, based on alphabetical order?
> 

Sorry, I've been AFK(SP) for a while, so I didn't see this.

Yes, there are some bad textures in the package.  I don't know what went wrong with the DDS conversion on them, but it sounds like you've already found the fix (delete them).  I don't know how Unity/KSP decides to load them - it looks like they're alphabetical in the log, so that's most likely how it does that.  I'm not sure what alexustas plans to do with them (fix them / delete them) - I haven't communicated with him directly except for a couple of other RPM / ASET things for a while.
I've already cleaned out most of the "garbage" textures, so I have to deal with the textures for MFD

Hey there, having some problems with what I can only assume to be either the ASET Props pack or the ASET Avionics pack.

FYI I am crossposting this on the Avionics thread as well.

[@alexustas](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/78632-alexustas/) hello. Just tried it. The game still crashes as before. Do you need me to send you the new logfile?

> 
>

> 
> 
> [@alexustas](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/78632-alexustas/) hello. Just tried it. The game still crashes as before. Do you need me to send you the new logfile?
> 

OK. I suggest you do the following experiment.

1. move the "Control" folder outside of the game folder. Delete KSP.log file. Start KSP and try to launch a capsule. Copy KSP.log file

2. move the "Instruments" folder outside of the game folder and put "Control" folder back into "ASET\_Porps". Delete KSP.log file. Start KSP and try to launch a capsule. Copy KSP.log file

3. repeat the same steps with "MFD",  "Misc", "Sounds" and "SpaceFoodPack"

4.  Give me all log files for situations where the game crash
